newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy govt gives dairy farmers breathing space.
newsitem.headline: Italy govt gives dairy farmers breathing space.

text.p: The Italian government on Wednesday gave dairy farmers a stay of execution for the payment of huge fines for producing too much milk.
The centre-left cabinet gave the farmers a breathing space by extending an inquiry into why the strict quotas were exceded.

Prime Minister Romano Prodi set up the inquiry earlier this year after farmers brought parts of Italy to a standstill to protest against European Union fines totalling some $167 million for overshooting milk production targets in 1995/96.
The inquiry released its initial findings on Tuesday, but the government has now given it until July to complete its investigations.
The agriculture ministry said in a statement the decision meant the deadline for payment of the fines was being extended to August 31 from the present May 11.
The initial inquiry commission findings suggested both the government and producers were to blame.

Farmers have blamed the government for not advising them of their correct quotas. But the commission also said that producers seemed unable to give a clear picture of their output, which confused the situation.
